senses.sense_definition: A condition in which tissues are deprived of an adequate supply of oxygen.

examples.text: The mountain climbers began to suffer from <w>hypoxia</w> as they reached higher altitudes without supplemental oxygen.
Doctors warned that prolonged <w>hypoxia</w> could result in permanent damage to the patient's brain.

senses.sense_definition: A reduced concentration of dissolved oxygen in an aquatic environment.

examples.text: Agricultural runoff often leads to <w>hypoxia</w> in coastal waters, creating dead zones where marine life cannot survive.
Researchers are monitoring the lake for seasonal <w>hypoxia</w> to protect the local fish population.
